required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Drotrecogin Alfa (Activated) in Adult Patients With Septic Shock
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter, Phase 3 Study of Drotrecogin Alfa (Activated) Administered as a Continuous 96-hr Infusion to Adult Patients With Septic Shock

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this placebo-controlled study is to determine if drotrecogin alfa (activated) treatment provides significant mortality reduction improvement in patients with septic shock compared with placebo treatment in patients receiving the current standard of care for septic shock. This study will also assess the effectiveness of drotrecogin alfa (activated) in reducing 28-day mortality in patients with septic shock and concomitant severe protein C deficiency.

primary_outcome.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 28 endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: 28-Day All-Cause Mortality in Participants With Severe Protein C Deficiency
secondary_outcome.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 28 endpoint. Participants with severe protein C deficiency are those who had a protein C level ≤ half the lower limit of normal (LLN) (≤40%).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Cardiovascular Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing cardiovascular dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Respiratory Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing respiratory dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Renal Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing renal dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.
Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 90 endpoint.
Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 180 endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: EuroQoL Questionnaire-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D VAS assesses caregiver's impression of participant's overall health state. Scores range from 0 (worst health state) to 100 (best health state), with higher scores indicating a better health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: EuroQoL Questionnaire-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Total Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D is used to assess participant's overall health. Consists of 5 items: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each item has 3 severity levels (no, some, severe problems). Calculated from EQ-5D, total scores (United States [US] Index Score) range from 0 (worst quality of life) to 1.00 (best quality of life).

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Short Form-12 (SF-12) Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
secondary_outcome.description: SF-12 was used as an instrument to measure participants' physical wellbeing (physical component) and mental wellbeing (mental component). Scores for each component range from 0-100, with 0= lowest wellbeing, and 100=highest wellbeing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Discontinued Due to Adverse Events Any Time From Baseline Through Day 28 Endpoint

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Serious Bleeding Events Within System Organ Class Any Time From Baseline Through Day 28
other_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who experienced serious bleeding events are reported by System Organ Class (SOC) term based on MedDRA 14.0. For a bleeding to qualify as a serious event, it would have to meet the standard definition of a serious adverse event or be a central nervous system bleeding or a bleeding event that lead to administration of ≥3 units packed red blood cells/day for 2 consecutive days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be 18 years or older
- Must have evidence of infection
- Must have systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS)
- Must have vasopressor-dependent septic shock
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received vasopressor therapy (at any dose) for greater than 24 hours prior to the start of study drug
- Have sepsis-induced organ dysfunction for greater than 36 hours prior to the start of the study drug infusion
- Have single organ dysfunction and recent surgery (within 30 days of study entry)
- Have had surgery performed within the 12-hour period immediately preceding the study drug infusion, or are postoperative with evidence of active bleeding, or have planned or anticipated surgery during the infusion period
- Are not expected to survive 28 days given their preexisting uncorrectable medical condition

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Primary Site of Infection
Cardiovascular Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing cardiovascular dysfunction. There were 12 participants in drotrecogin alfa (activated) and 14 participants in placebo who were unspecified and were not included in the calculation of mean and standard deviation.

measure.title: Respiratory Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing respiratory dysfunction. There were 35 participants in drotrecogin alfa (activated) and 34 participants in placebo who were unspecified and were not included in the calculation of mean and standard deviation.

measure.title: Renal Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing renal dysfunction. There were 12 participants in drotrecogin alfa (activated) and 17 participants in placebo who were unspecified and were not included in the calculation of mean and standard deviation.

measure.title: Coagulation Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating worsening coagulopathy (decreasing platelet counts). There were 11 participants in drotrecogin alfa (activated) and 17 participants in placebo who were unspecified and were not included in the calculation of mean and standard deviation.

measure.title: Liver Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing liver dysfunction. There were 61 participants in drotrecogin alfa (activated) and 70 participants in placebo who were unspecified and were not included in the calculation of mean and standard deviation.

measure.title: Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II (APACHE II) Score
measure.description: Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II (APACHE II) score is a severity-of-disease classification system. Scores range from 0 to 71. Higher scores correspond to more severe disease and a higher risk of death. There were 4 participants in drotrecogin alfa (activated) and 1 participant in placebo who were unspecified and were not included in the calculation of mean and standard deviation.

outcome.title: 28-Day All-Cause Mortality
outcome.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 28 endpoint.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with known mortality status at Day 28.

measure.title: 28-Day All-Cause Mortality
measure.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 28 endpoint.
measure.population: All randomized participants with known mortality status at Day 28.

analysis.groups_desc: The study was planned to have 80% power to detect a 20% relative risk reduction in 28-day all-cause mortality in drotrecogin alpha (activated) compared to placebo. The final power was 75% because of the lower than anticipated placebo mortality.
analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustment for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: 28-Day All-Cause Mortality in Participants With Severe Protein C Deficiency
outcome.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 28 endpoint. Participants with severe protein C deficiency are those who had a protein C level ≤ half the lower limit of normal (LLN) (≤40%).
outcome.population: All randomized participants with severe protein C deficiency at Baseline with known mortality status at Day 28.

measure.title: 28-Day All-Cause Mortality in Participants With Severe Protein C Deficiency
measure.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 28 endpoint. Participants with severe protein C deficiency are those who had a protein C level ≤ half the lower limit of normal (LLN) (≤40%).
measure.population: All randomized participants with severe protein C deficiency at Baseline with known mortality status at Day 28.

analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Average Cardiovascular Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
outcome.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing cardiovascular dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with any post-baseline data on Day 1 through Day 28. For those days when a participant is alive, but no data are available, last observation carried forward (LOFC) is used to impute the missing data. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

measure.title: Average Cardiovascular Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing cardiovascular dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.
measure.population: All randomized participants with any post-baseline data on Day 1 through Day 28. For those days when a participant is alive, but no data are available, last observation carried forward (LOFC) is used to impute the missing data. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Average Respiratory Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
outcome.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing respiratory dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with any post-baseline data on Day 1 through Day 28. For those days when a participant is alive, but no data are available, last observation carried forward (LOFC) is used to impute the missing data. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

measure.title: Average Respiratory Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing respiratory dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.
measure.population: All randomized participants with any post-baseline data on Day 1 through Day 28. For those days when a participant is alive, but no data are available, last observation carried forward (LOFC) is used to impute the missing data. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Average Renal Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
outcome.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing renal dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with any post-baseline data on Day 1 through Day 28. For those days when a participant is alive, but no data are available, last observation carried forward (LOFC) is used to impute the missing data. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

measure.title: Average Renal Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score Day 1 Through Day 28
measure.description: Scores range from 0 (normal) to 4 (organ failure) with an increasing score indicating increasing renal dysfunction. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.
measure.population: All randomized participants with any post-baseline data on Day 1 through Day 28. For those days when a participant is alive, but no data are available, last observation carried forward (LOFC) is used to impute the missing data. A non-surviving participant receives a score of 4 (worst score) for the day of death and every day thereafter.

analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: 90-Day Mortality
outcome.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 90 endpoint.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with known mortality status at Day 90.

measure.title: 90-Day Mortality
measure.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 90 endpoint.
measure.population: All randomized participants with known mortality status at Day 90.

analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: 180-Day Mortality
outcome.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 180 endpoint.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with known mortality status at Day 180.

measure.title: 180-Day Mortality
measure.description: Expressed as percentage of participants who died from any cause at Day 180 endpoint.
measure.population: All randomized participants with known mortality status at Day 180.

analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Median Survival Time
outcome.population: All randomized participants excluding those with unknown mortality status at Day 180.

measure.title: Median Survival Time
measure.population: All randomized participants excluding those with unknown mortality status at Day 180.

measurement_list.measurement: Median value was not calculated due to less than 50% of participants reaching mortality endpoint at Day 180.
Median value was not calculated due to less than 50% of participants reaching mortality endpoint at Day 180.

outcome.title: EuroQoL Questionnaire-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
outcome.description: EQ-5D VAS assesses caregiver's impression of participant's overall health state. Scores range from 0 (worst health state) to 100 (best health state), with higher scores indicating a better health state.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with EQ-5D VAS data at the specified time points.

measure.title: EuroQoL Questionnaire-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
measure.description: EQ-5D VAS assesses caregiver's impression of participant's overall health state. Scores range from 0 (worst health state) to 100 (best health state), with higher scores indicating a better health state.
measure.population: All randomized participants with EQ-5D VAS data at the specified time points.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is for Baseline, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for Day 28, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for Day 90, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for Day 180, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: EuroQoL Questionnaire-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Total Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
outcome.description: The EQ-5D is used to assess participant's overall health. Consists of 5 items: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each item has 3 severity levels (no, some, severe problems). Calculated from EQ-5D, total scores (United States [US] Index Score) range from 0 (worst quality of life) to 1.00 (best quality of life).
outcome.population: All randomized participants with EQ-5D total score data at the specified time points.

measure.title: EuroQoL Questionnaire-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Total Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
measure.description: The EQ-5D is used to assess participant's overall health. Consists of 5 items: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each item has 3 severity levels (no, some, severe problems). Calculated from EQ-5D, total scores (United States [US] Index Score) range from 0 (worst quality of life) to 1.00 (best quality of life).
measure.population: All randomized participants with EQ-5D total score data at the specified time points.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is for Baseline, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for Day 28, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for Day 90, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for Day 180, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Quality of Life Short Form-12 (SF-12) Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
outcome.description: SF-12 was used as an instrument to measure participants’ physical wellbeing (physical component) and mental wellbeing (mental component). Scores for each component range from 0-100, with 0= lowest wellbeing, and 100=highest wellbeing.
outcome.population: All randomized participants with SF-12 score data at the specified time points.

measure.title: Quality of Life Short Form-12 (SF-12) Scores at Baseline, Days 28, 90 and 180
measure.description: SF-12 was used as an instrument to measure participants’ physical wellbeing (physical component) and mental wellbeing (mental component). Scores for each component range from 0-100, with 0= lowest wellbeing, and 100=highest wellbeing.
measure.population: All randomized participants with SF-12 score data at the specified time points.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is for physical component at Baseline, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for physical component at Day 28, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for physical component at Day 90, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for physical component at Day 180, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for mental component at Baseline, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for mental component at Day 28, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for mental component at Day 90, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.
P-value is for mental component at Day 180, unadjusted for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Serious Bleeding Events Within System Organ Class Any Time From Baseline Through Day 28
outcome.description: Percentage of participants who experienced serious bleeding events are reported by System Organ Class (SOC) term based on MedDRA 14.0. For a bleeding to qualify as a serious event, it would have to meet the standard definition of a serious adverse event or be a central nervous system bleeding or a bleeding event that lead to administration of ≥3 units packed red blood cells/day for 2 consecutive days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Serious Bleeding Events Within System Organ Class Any Time From Baseline Through Day 28
measure.description: Percentage of participants who experienced serious bleeding events are reported by System Organ Class (SOC) term based on MedDRA 14.0. For a bleeding to qualify as a serious event, it would have to meet the standard definition of a serious adverse event or be a central nervous system bleeding or a bleeding event that lead to administration of ≥3 units packed red blood cells/day for 2 consecutive days.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is for participants with ≥1 event. No adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Discontinued Due to Adverse Events Any Time From Baseline Through Day 28 Endpoint

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Discontinued Due to Adverse Events Any Time From Baseline Through Day 28 Endpoint

analysis.p_value_desc: Unadjusted for multiple comparisons.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the site PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo. An independent Steering Committee responsible for data analyses and publications did not have an embargo.
